XI.i.1.D.1.a
.
Criteria for an Acceptable NOD
A notice of death (NOD) is acceptable if it
furnishes sufficient information about the beneficiary to allow a definite identification of the proper record, and
identifies the source of the report of the death.
There is
no
requirement that an NOD be in writing or originate with the next of kin.
Examples
:
An NOD may originate with a funeral home or other third party.
A report of contact based on a telephone call is acceptable if the report clearly identifies the deceased beneficiary and the caller.
Exception
:Â  If the NOD is a returned check indicating that the beneficiary is deceased, identification of the source of the report of death is not necessary.
